com.distiller

Class AnnotationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.distiller.AnnotationManager

  • public class AnnotationManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The annotation manager operates on a single (text) document and identifies all (word) patterns and named entities you've defined. It returns first the same document as text file where all encountered instances of the patterns (including named entities) are annotated. It returns, in addition, an xml file containing just the extracted instances of the patterns.

    It uses all available patterns. However, connector patterns are used only implicitly and do not appear as explicit annotations.

    For example:

    Original text:

    Franz Kafka (3 July 1883 - 3 June 1924) was a German-language writer ...

    Annotated text: <author><name>Franz</name> Kafka <lifetime>(<birthdate><date>1883-7-3</date></birthdate> - <death date><date>1924-6-3</date></death date>)</lifetime> was a German</author> ...

    XML prepresentation:

    <authors>

      <author>

        <name>Franz</name>

        <lifetime>

          <birthdate>

            <date>1883-7-3</date>

          </birthdate>

          <death_date>

            <date>1924-6-3</date>

          </death_date>

        </lifetime>

      </author>

    ...

    The annotation manager requires a number of auxiliary files such as lists containing the names of days, months or numbers (expressed in words).

    The manager uses five classes of patterns:

    (1) connectorPatterns. They are pure Regular Expressions and listed in the file "connector.patterns".

    Examples:

    numeric,numerics=\d+([\-\.\,]\d+)*

    decimal,decimales=(\d{1,3}[.,]?)+\-?;;\d+[,.]\d+

    WORD,WORDS=\b\p{Lu}+([\-\p{Lu}']+)?\b

    Word,Words=\b\p{Lu}[\p{Ll}']*(\-?\p{Lu}[\p{Ll}']*)?\b

    phrase,phrases=\b["'\p{L}\p{N}]*([, /\-"'\p{L}\p{N}]*)?\b

    year,years=[1-2]\d{3}(\-\d{1,2})?

    (2) basic named entities. These patterns are again purely Regular Expressions (file name: "basic named.entities".

    In contrast to connectorPatterns they appear explicitly in the annotations.

    Example:

    date,dates=\d{4}-\d{1,2}-\d{1,2};;\d{1,2}[/.]\d{1,2}[./]\d{4};;\d{4}-\d{1,2}

    (3) named entities. These patterns are a bit more complex. Here you can mix Regular Expressions with already defined connector patterns and basic named entities.

    Example:

    time from="from".year:year

    time to="to".year:year

    time from="after".words.year:year

    lifetime,lifetimes="\(".date:birthdate.date:death date."\)"

    title,title=phrase:german."\(".phrase:english."\)"

    (4) word patterns. These are the most complex patterns. You compose them from all previous patterns.

    Example:

    birthplace="born".Words

    author,authors=Words:name.lifetime."german"

    death,deaths=words."dies";"died".?words,date

    play,plays="production";"premiere";"drama";"works".titles

    Version:
    4.0.1
    Author:
    Kurt Englmeier

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnnotationManager

        public AnnotationManager(com.distiller.docs.Document document,
                 java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> wordlist_numbers,
                 java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> wordlist_months,
                 java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> wordlist_days,
                 com.distiller.docs.PatternSet connectorPatterns,
                 com.distiller.docs.PatternSet wordPatterns,
                 com.distiller.docs.PatternSet basicNamedEntities,
                 com.distiller.docs.PatternSet namedEntities,
                 com.distiller.docs.PatternSet locationBasedVariables)
        The constructor equips the manager with all necessary information.

        The annotation manager uses

        • three auxiliary vectors<String>: numbers (expressed as words), names of weekdays, names of months
        • the input document wrapped in an instance of Document
        • the patterns as described above
        Parameters:
        document - an instance of Document containing the text needs to be processed. The file name is defined in messages.properties.
        wordlist_numbers - numbers rendered as words. The file name is defined in messages.properties.
        wordlist_months - names of months. The file name is defined in messages.properties.
        wordlist_days - names of days. The file name is defined in messages.properties.
        connectorPatterns - basic patterns that are used in other patterns, but do not appear explicitly. The define purely Regular Expressions.
        basicNamedEntities - much like basic patterns, but they do appear explicitly (as tags for instance).
        namedEntities - mix of basic patterns and Regular Expressions
        wordPatterns - complex patterns that use all previous patterns
        locationBasedVariables - sequence of word patterns, but they are identified only once, respectively.
        See Also:
        Document

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(com.distiller.web.Status status)
        Runs the annotation process in a separate thread for each document.
        Parameters:
        status - information on the actual state of the document to be processed.
        See Also:
        Status
